Definition.WordDefinition:
Straighten \Straight"en\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Straighted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Straighting}.] 1. To make straight; to reduce from a crooked to a straight form. [1913 Webster]
2. To make right or correct; to reduce to order; as, to straighten one's affairs; to straighten an account. [1913 Webster]
{To straighten one's face}, to cease laughing or smiling, etc., and compose one's features. [1913 Webster]

Definition.WordDefinition: Straighten \Straight"en\, v. t. A variant of {Straiten}. [Obs. or R.] [1913 Webster]

straighten v 1: straighten up or out; make straight [syn: {unbend}] [ant: {bend}] 2: make straight [syn: {straighten out}] 3: get up from a sitting or slouching position; "The students straightened when the teacher entered" 4: put (things or places) in order; "Tidy up your room!" [syn: {tidy}, {tidy up}, {clean up}, {neaten}, {straighten out}, {square away}] 5: straighten by unrolling; "roll out the big map" [syn: {roll out}] 6: make straight or straighter; "Straighten this post"; "straighten hair"
